result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damarion M Pollard

defendant.name: Pollard, Damarion M
defendant.address: 144 S Fair Oaks Ave Apt 101, Madison, WI 53704

records.addlTxt:
Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
 Defn in custody; Defn eligible for SPD (verified) but no appointment as of yet; Defn waived time limits; preliminary hearing to be scheduled after appointment of counsel; bail continued

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

10:01 AM Defendant Damarion M Pollard in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter R. Moyers in court for Damarion M Pollard.  Prosecuting attorney Theresa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin.  State motions for transactional relation, no objection by defense, ct finds so.  State calls Law Enforcement, duly sworn. Direct by the State. Witness id'd De.  Cross exam. State moves for bindover, reserves for rebuttal.   Defense objects with argument.   CT finds PC to bind case over.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
- Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior approval of the Court. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 7

2:44 PM Defendant Damarion M Pollard in court, in custody via Zoom.  Attorney Devonte D Windham in court for Damarion M Pollard.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
